blocks.name: cfz
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the notation for a contiguous finite set of integers. Read " ` M ... N ` " as "the set of integers from ` M ` to ` N ` inclusive."
blocks.origin: const class cfz { ... }

blocks.name: diff.cfz.s
diff.cfz.c
diff.cfz.w
df-fz
blocks.content: Define an operation that produces a finite set of sequential integers. Read " ` M ... N ` " as "the set of integers from ` M ` to ` N ` inclusive." See ~ fzval for its value and additional comments. (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.)

blocks.name: fzval
blocks.content: The value of a finite set of sequential integers. E.g., ` 2 ... 5 ` means the set ` { 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 } ` . A special case of this definition (starting at 1) appears as Definition 11-2.1 of [Gleason] p. 141, where ` NN ` _k means our ` 1 ... k ` ; he calls these sets _segments_ of the integers. (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(co(c0, cfz, c1), crab(s0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, cz, c1, cz, cfz, crab(s0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1))), crab(s0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1)))), crab(s0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1)))))
  rabbidv(s0, cz, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1))), wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1))))
  anbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c0, cle, cv(s0))
  rabbidv(s0, cz, wceq(cv(hs1), c1), wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1))), wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1)))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(hs1), c1), wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1))
  breq2(cv(hs1), c1, cv(s0), cle)
  df-fz(hs0, hs1, s0)
  rabex(s0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1)))
  zex()
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1))))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(crab(s0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs1), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)→(c0[...]c1)= { s0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]c1)})
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, cz, c1, cz, cfz, { s0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]c1)}, { s0 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]hs1)}, { s0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]hs1)})
  rabbidv(s0, cz, hs0 = c0, (hs0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]hs1), (c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]hs1))
  anbi1d(hs0 = c0, hs0[≤]s0, s0[≤]hs1, c0[≤]s0)
  breq1(hs0, c0, cle, s0)
  rabbidv(s0, cz, hs1 = c1, (c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]hs1), (c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]c1))
  anbi2d(hs1 = c1, c0[≤]s0, s0[≤]hs1, s0[≤]c1)
  breq2(hs1, c1, s0, cle)
  df-fz(hs0, hs1, s0)
  rabex(s0, cz, (c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]c1))
  zex()
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]c1)})
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c({ s0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]s0 ∧ s0[≤]c1)})
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs1, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: fzval2
blocks.content: An alternative way of expressing a finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzval2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(co(c0, cfz, c1), cin(co(c0, cicc, c1), cz)))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(c0, cfz, c1), cin(co(c0, cicc, c1), cz), crab(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  fzval(hs0, c0, c1)
  syl6req(crab(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))), cin(co(c0, cicc, c1), cz), cin(crab(hs0, cxr, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))), cz), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  ineq1d(co(c0, cicc, c1), cz, crab(hs0, cxr, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cicc, c1), crab(hs0, cxr, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1)))), wcel(c0, cxr), wcel(c1, cxr))
  sseli(c0, cz, cxr)
  sseli(c1, cz, cxr)
  iccval(hs0, c0, c1)
  eqtri(cin(crab(hs0, cxr, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))), cz), crab(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))), crab(hs0, cin(cxr, cz), wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))))
  inrab2(hs0, cxr, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1)))
  rabeqi(hs0, cin(cxr, cz), cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1)))
  mpbi(wceq(cin(cxr, cz), cz), wss(cz, cxr))
  sstri(cz, cxr, cr)
  zssre()
  ressxr()
  sseqin2(cz, cxr)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(cin(cxr, cz))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzval2(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)→(c0[...]c1)=((c0[[,]]c1)⋂ ℤ))
} = {
  eqtrd((c0[...]c1), ((c0[[,]]c1)⋂ ℤ), { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)}, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ))
  fzval(hs0, c0, c1)
  syl6req({ hs0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)}, ((c0[[,]]c1)⋂ ℤ), ({ hs0 ∈ ℝ* |(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)} ⋂ ℤ), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ))
  ineq1d((c0[[,]]c1), cz, { hs0 ∈ ℝ* |(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)}, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ))
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, (c0[[,]]c1)= { hs0 ∈ ℝ* |(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)}, c0 ∈ ℝ*, c1 ∈ ℝ*)
  sseli(c0, cz, cxr)
  sseli(c1, cz, cxr)
  iccval(hs0, c0, c1)
  eqtri(({ hs0 ∈ ℝ* |(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)} ⋂ ℤ), { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)}, { hs0 ∈(ℝ* ⋂ ℤ)|(c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1)})
  inrab2(hs0, cxr, cz, (c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1))
  rabeqi(hs0, (ℝ* ⋂ ℤ), cz, (c0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[≤]c1))
  mpbi((ℝ* ⋂ ℤ)= ℤ, ℤ ⊆ ℝ*)
  sstri(cz, cxr, cr)
  zssre()
  ressxr()
  sseqin2(cz, cxr)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c((ℝ* ⋂ ℤ))
}

blocks.name: fzf
blocks.content: Establish the domain and codomain of the finite integer sequence function. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 8-Aug-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzf() {
  |- wf(cfz, cxp(cz, cz), cpw(cz))
} = {
  mpbi(wf(cfz, cxp(cz, cz), cpw(cz)), wral(hs0, cz, wral(hs2, cz, wcel(crab(hs1, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cv(hs2)))), cpw(cz)))))
  rgen2w(hs0, hs2, cz, cz, wcel(crab(hs1, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cv(hs2)))), cpw(cz)))
  elpwi2(crab(hs1, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cv(hs2)))), cz, universe)
  zex()
  ssrab2(hs1, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cv(hs2))))
  fmpt2(hs0, hs2, cz, cz, crab(hs1, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cv(hs2)))), cpw(cz), cfz)
  df-fz(hs0, hs2, hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(cz))
  diff.hs2.c(cz)
  diff.hs2.c(cpw(cz))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzf() {
  ⊢ (... :(ℤ × ℤ)→ P(ℤ))
} = {
  mpbi((... :(ℤ × ℤ)→ P(ℤ)), ∀(hs0 ∈ ℤ, ∀(hs2 ∈ ℤ, { hs1 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[≤]hs1 ∧ hs1[≤]hs2)} ∈ P(ℤ))))
  rgen2w(hs0, hs2, cz, cz, { hs1 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[≤]hs1 ∧ hs1[≤]hs2)} ∈ P(ℤ))
  elpwi2({ hs1 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[≤]hs1 ∧ hs1[≤]hs2)}, cz, universe)
  zex()
  ssrab2(hs1, cz, (hs0[≤]hs1 ∧ hs1[≤]hs2))
  fmpt2(hs0, hs2, cz, cz, { hs1 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[≤]hs1 ∧ hs1[≤]hs2)}, P(ℤ), cfz)
  df-fz(hs0, hs2, hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(P(ℤ))
  diff.hs2.c(cz)
  diff.hs2.c(P(ℤ))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
}

blocks.name: elfz1
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jul-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfz1(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1)), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))))
} = {
  syl6bb(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1)), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wcel(c2, crab(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1)))))
  eleq2d(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1), crab(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  fzval(hs0, c0, c1)
  bitr4i(wcel(c2, crab(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1)))), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))))
  elrab(hs0, c2, cz, wa(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1)))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c1), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c2, c0, cle)
  breq1(cv(hs0), c2, cle, c1)
  3anass(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1)))
}

blocks.name: elfz2
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers. We use the fact that an operation's value is empty outside of its domain to show ` M e. ZZ ` and ` N e. ZZ ` . (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfz2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wa(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))
} = {
  3bitr4ri(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wa(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))))
  anass(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  anbi1i(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, cz)))
  df-3an(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  pm2.61i(wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  elfz1(c1, c2, c0)
  syl5bb(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))
  3anass(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))
  ibar(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))
  bitrd(wn(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz))), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))), wcel(c0, emptycls))
  eleq2d(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2), emptycls, wn(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz))))
  ndmov(c1, cz, c2, cfz)
  fdmi(cfz, cxp(cz, cz), cpw(cz))
  fzf()
  pm5.21ni(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wcel(c0, emptycls), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))))
  pm2.21i(wcel(c0, emptycls), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)))
  noel(c0)
  simpl(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))))
}

blocks.name: eluzfz
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by NM, 4-Oct-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzuz
blocks.content: A member of a finite set of sequential integers belongs to an upper set of integers. (Contributed by NM, 17-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzuz3
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers implies membership in an upper set of integers. (Contributed by NM, 28-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzel2
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integer implies the upper bound is an integer. (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzel1
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integer implies the lower bound is an integer. (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzelz
blocks.content: A member of a finite set of sequential integer is an integer. (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: fzssz
blocks.content: A finite sequence of integers is a set of integers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: elfzle1
blocks.content: A member of a finite set of sequential integer is greater than or equal to the lower bound. (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzle2
blocks.content: A member of a finite set of sequential integer is less than or equal to the upper bound. (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzuz2
blocks.content: Implication of membership in a finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by NM, 20-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfzle3
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integer implies the bounds are comparable. (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: eluzfz1
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers - special case. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jul-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: eluzfz2
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers - special case. (Contributed by NM, 13-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: eluzfz2b
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers - special case. (Contributed by NM, 14-Sep-2005.)

blocks.name: elfz3
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers containing one integer. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jul-2005.)

blocks.name: elfz1eq
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers containing one integer. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfz1eq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c1)), wceq(c0, c1))
} = {
  mpbir2and(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c1)), wceq(c0, c1), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  elfzle2(c0, c1, c1)
  elfzle1(c0, c1, c1)
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c1)), wb(wceq(c0, c1), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(c1, cle, c0))), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  elfzelz(c0, c1, c1)
  elfzel2(c0, c1, c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wceq(c0, c1), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(c1, cle, c0))), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c0)
  zre(c1)
  letri3(c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elfz1eq(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(c1[...]c1)→ c0 = c1)
} = {
  mpbir2and(c0 ∈(c1[...]c1), c0 = c1, c0[≤]c1, c1[≤]c0)
  elfzle2(c0, c1, c1)
  elfzle1(c0, c1, c1)
  syl2anc(c0 ∈(c1[...]c1), (c0 = c1 ↔(c0[≤]c1 ∧ c1[≤]c0)), c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  elfzelz(c0, c1, c1)
  elfzel2(c0, c1, c1)
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, (c0 = c1 ↔(c0[≤]c1 ∧ c1[≤]c0)), c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ)
  zre(c0)
  zre(c1)
  letri3(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: elfzubelfz
blocks.content: If there is a member in a finite set of sequential integers, the upper bound is also a member of this finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-May-2018.)

blocks.name: peano2fzr
blocks.content: A Peano-postulate-like theorem for downward closure of a finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-May-2014.)

blocks.name: fzn0
blocks.content: Properties of a finite interval of integers which is nonempty. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 17-Jun-2010.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: fz0
blocks.content: A finite set of sequential integers is empty if its bounds are not integers. (Contributed by AV, 13-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: fzn
blocks.content: A finite set of sequential integers is empty if the bounds are reversed. (Contributed by NM, 22-Aug-2005.)

blocks.name: fzen
blocks.content: A shifted finite set of sequential integers is equinumerous to the original set. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 11-Apr-2009.)

blocks.name: fz1n
blocks.content: A 1-based finite set of sequential integers is empty iff it ends at index ` 0 ` . (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: 0nelfz1
blocks.content: 0 is not an element of a finite interval of integers starting at 1. (Contributed by AV, 27-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: 0fz1
blocks.content: Two ways to say a finite 1-based sequence is empty. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 26-Oct-2012.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: fz10
blocks.content: There are no integers between 1 and 0. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 16-Jun-2010.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

  adantl(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cfz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, c3)), wcel(c1, cz))
  elfzel1(cv(hs0), c1, c3)
  adantl(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cfz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), cr))
  zred(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, c3)))

blocks.name: fzass4
blocks.content: Two ways to express a nondecreasing sequence of four integers. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzass4(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

blocks.name: fzss1
blocks.content: Subset relationship for finite sets of sequential integers. (Contributed by NM, 28-Sep-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzss1(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wss(co(c0, cfz, c2), co(c1, cfz, c2)))
} = {
  ssrdv(hs0, co(c0, cfz, c2), co(c1, cfz, c2), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  ex(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, c2)))
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))))
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  elfzuz(cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  id(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  uztrn(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))))
  elfzuz3(cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  elfzuzb(cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cfz, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c1, cfz, c2))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
}

blocks.name: fzss2
blocks.content: Subset relationship for finite sets of sequential integers. (Contributed by NM, 4-Oct-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.)

thm fzss2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wss(co(c2, cfz, c1), co(c2, cfz, c0)))
} = {
  ssrdv(hs0, co(c2, cfz, c1), co(c2, cfz, c0), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  ex(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cfz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cfz, c0)))

  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cfz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c2)))
  elfzuz(cv(hs0), c2, c1)
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cfz, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))))
  elfzuz3(cv(hs0), c2, c1)
  uztrn(c0, c1, cv(hs0))
  elfzuzb(cv(hs0), c2, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c2, cfz, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c2, cfz, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))

blocks.name: fzssuz
blocks.content: A finite set of sequential integers is a subset of an upper set of integers. (Contributed by NM, 28-Oct-2005.)

blocks.name: fzsn
blocks.content: A finite interval of integers with one element. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm fzsn(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(co(c0, cfz, c0), csn(c0)))
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, co(c0, cfz, c0), csn(c0), wcel(c0, cz))
  syl6bbr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), csn(c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  impbid2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  elfz1eq(cv(hs0), c0)
  syl5ibrcom(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c0)), wcel(c0, co(c0, cfz, c0)))
  elfz3(c0)
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, co(c0, cfz, c0))
  velsn(hs0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cfz, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(csn(c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cz))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fzsn(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℤ →(c0[...]c0)= { c0 })
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, (c0[...]c0), { c0 }, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  syl6bbr(c0 ∈ ℤ, hs0 ∈(c0[...]c0), hs0 ∈ { c0 }, hs0 = c0)
  impbid2(c0 ∈ ℤ, hs0 ∈(c0[...]c0), hs0 = c0)
  elfz1eq(hs0, c0)
  syl5ibrcom(c0 ∈ ℤ, hs0 = c0, hs0 ∈(c0[...]c0), c0 ∈(c0[...]c0))
  elfz3(c0)
  eleq1(hs0, c0, (c0[...]c0))
  velsn(hs0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[...]c0))
  diff.hs0.c({ c0 })
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ ℤ)
}

blocks.name: fzssnn
blocks.content: Finite sets of sequential integers starting from a natural are a subset of the positive integers. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 4-Aug-2017.)

  3ad2ant2(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c3), wcel(c3, cxr))

} = {

  raleqi(s0, co(nat1, cfz, nat2), cpr(nat1, nat2), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, c2, wceq(cv(s0), nat1))))
  fz12pr()

  1ex()
  2ex()
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, c2, wceq(cv(s0), nat1)), cfv(c0, nat1), c1, wceq(cv(s0), nat1))
  fveq2(cv(s0), nat1, c0)

  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, nat1)

thm fzprval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (∀(s0 ∈(1[...]2),(c0 ` s0)= if(s0 = 1, c1, c2))↔((c0 ` 1)= c1 ∧(c0 ` 2)= c2))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  bitri(∀(s0 ∈(1[...]2),(c0 ` s0)= if(s0 = 1, c1, c2)), ((c0 ` 1)= c1 ∧(c0 ` 2)= c2), ∀(s0 ∈ { 1, 2 },(c0 ` s0)= if(s0 = 1, c1, c2)))
  raleqi(s0, (1[...]2), { 1, 2 }, (c0 ` s0)= if(s0 = 1, c1, c2))
  fz12pr()
  ralpr(s0, nat1, nat2, (c0 ` s0)= if(s0 = 1, c1, c2), (c0 ` 1)= c1, (c0 ` 2)= c2)
  1ex()
  2ex()
  eqeq12d((c0 ` s0), if(s0 = 1, c1, c2), (c0 ` 1), c1, s0 = 1)
  fveq2(s0, nat1, c0)
  iftrue(c1, c2, s0 = 1)
  eqeq12d((c0 ` s0), if(s0 = 1, c1, c2), (c0 ` 2), c2, s0 = 2)
  fveq2(s0, nat2, c0)
  iffalsed(c1, c2, s0 = 2, s0 = 1)
  neneqd(s0, nat1, s0 = 2)
  mpan2(s0 = 2, s0 ≠ 1, 2 ≠ 1)
  necomi(nat2, nat1)
  1ne2()
  pm13.181(s0, nat2, nat1)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, nat2)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.cpr.s(s0, nat1, nat2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, (c0 ` 1), c1)

}

blocks.name: fztpval

thm fztpval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

} = {
  bitri(wral(s0, co(nat1, cfz, nat3), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), nat1)))), w3a(wceq(cfv(c0, nat1), c1), wceq(cfv(c0, nat2), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, nat3), c3)), wral(s0, ctp(nat1, nat2, nat3), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), nat1)))))
  raleqi(s0, co(nat1, cfz, nat3), ctp(nat1, nat2, nat3), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), nat1))))
  3eqtr4i(co(nat1, cfz, nat3), ctp(nat1, nat2, nat3), co(nat1, cfz, co(nat1, caddc, nat2)), ctp(nat1, co(nat1, caddc, nat1), co(nat1, caddc, nat2)))
  ax-mp(wceq(co(nat1, cfz, co(nat1, caddc, nat2)), ctp(nat1, co(nat1, caddc, nat1), co(nat1, caddc, nat2))), wcel(nat1, cz))
  1z()
  fztp(nat1)
  oveq2i(nat1, cfz, nat3, co(nat1, caddc, nat2))
  eqtri(ctp(nat1, nat2, nat3), ctp(nat1, co(nat1, caddc, nat1), co(nat1, caddc, nat2)), ctp(nat1, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat2)))
  ax-mp(wceq(ctp(nat1, nat2, nat3), ctp(nat1, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat2))), wceq(nat3, co(nat1, caddc, nat2)))
  eqtri(nat3, co(nat1, caddc, nat2), co(nat2, caddc, nat1))
  df-3()
  addcomi(nat2, nat1)
  2cn()
  ax-1cn()
  tpeq3(nat3, co(nat1, caddc, nat2), nat1, nat2)
  ax-mp(wceq(ctp(nat1, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat2)), ctp(nat1, co(nat1, caddc, nat1), co(nat1, caddc, nat2))), wceq(nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1)))
  df-2()
  tpeq2(nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1), nat1, co(nat1, caddc, nat2))
  raltp(s0, nat1, nat2, nat3, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), nat1))), wceq(cfv(c0, nat1), c1), wceq(cfv(c0, nat2), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, nat3), c3))
  1ex()
  2ex()
  3ex()
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), nat1)), cfv(c0, nat1), c1, wceq(cv(s0), nat1))
  fveq2(cv(s0), nat1, c0)
  iftrue(c1, cif(c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), nat1))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), nat1)), cfv(c0, nat2), c2, wceq(cv(s0), nat2))

thm fzrev(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  3bitr4d(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wcel(c3, co(co(c2, cmin, c1), cfz, co(c2, cmin, c0))), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c3), co(c0, cfz, c1)), wa(wbr(co(c2, cmin, c1), cle, c3), wbr(c3, cle, co(c2, cmin, c0))), wa(wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, c3)), wbr(co(c2, cmin, c3), cle, c1)))

  3expb(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wb(wbr(co(c2, cmin, c3), cle, c1), wbr(co(c2, cmin, c1), cle, c3)))

  zre(c1)
  suble(c2, c3, c1)
  adantlr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, c3)), wbr(c3, cle, co(c2, cmin, c0))))
  3expb(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wb(wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, c3)), wbr(c3, cle, co(c2, cmin, c0))))
  syl3an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wb(wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, c3)), wbr(c3, cle, co(c2, cmin, c0))), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c3, cr))
  zre(c0)
  zre(c2)
  zre(c3)
  lesub(c0, c2, c3)
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wb(wcel(c3, co(co(c2, cmin, c1), cfz, co(c2, cmin, c0))), wa(wbr(co(c2, cmin, c1), cle, c3), wbr(c3, cle, co(c2, cmin, c0)))), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c1), cz), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c0), cz))
  simprr(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))
  ad2ant2lr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c1), cz))
  ancoms(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c1), cz))
  zsubcl(c2, c1)
  ad2ant2r(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c0), cz))
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c0), cz))
  zsubcl(c2, c0)
  elfz(c3, co(c2, cmin, c1), co(c2, cmin, c0))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))), wb(wcel(co(c2, cmin, c3), co(c0, cfz, c1)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, co(c2, cmin, c3)), wbr(co(c2, cmin, c3), cle, c1))), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c3), cz), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))

  jca(wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c3), cz))
  simpl(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))

  fzrev(c0, c1, c2, co(c2, cmin, c3))
  eleq1d(co(c2, cmin, co(c2, cmin, c3)), co(c0, cfz, c1), c3, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz))))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cz)), wceq(co(c2, cmin, co(c2, cmin, c3)), c3))

  zcn(c2)
  zcn(c3)

  simpl2(wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wa(wbr(nat1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  imp(w3a(wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(nat1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wbr(nat1, cle, c1))
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wi(wa(wbr(nat1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wbr(nat1, cle, c1)), wcel(nat1, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr))
  1red(w3a(wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c0, cr))

  3ad2ant2(wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c1)

  biimpd(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfz, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  3anan12(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c0, cle, c1))
  3imp21(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfz, c1)))

  biimprd(wcel(c1, cn), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfz, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c1, cn), wb(wcel(c0, co(nat1, cfz, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(c0, cle, c1))), wcel(c1, cz))

blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential integers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Mar-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfzm11(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1))), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1))))
} = {
  bitr4d(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1))), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1)), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1))))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1))), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))), wcel(co(c1, cmin, nat1), cz))
  peano2zm(c1)
  elfz1(c0, co(c1, cmin, nat1), c2)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wb(w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1)), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))))
  3bitr4g(wcel(c1, cz), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1)), w3a(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1))), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1))), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))))
  pm5.32d(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1))))
  expcom(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wb(wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))))
  anbi2d(wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))
  zltlem1(c2, c1)
  3anass(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1))
  3anass(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))
}

blocks.name: uzsplit
blocks.content: Express an upper integer set as the disjoint (see ~ uzdisj ) union of the first ` N ` values and the rest. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzsplit(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wceq(cfv(cuz, c1), cun(co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c0))))
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, cfv(cuz, c1), cun(co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  syl6bbr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cun(co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c0))), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0))))
  impbid(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0))))
  ex(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0))))
  orcomd(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)))
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1))), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wo(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wo(wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0)), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cr))
  eluzelre(c0, c1)
  eluzelre(cv(hs0), c1)
  lelttric(c0, cv(hs0))
  orbi12d(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz))
  eluz(c0, cv(hs0))
  mpbirand(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))))
  jca(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)))
  eluzelz(cv(hs0), c1)
  eluzle(cv(hs0), c1)
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  eluzel2(cv(hs0), c1)
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  syl6bb(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0)), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0)))
  elfzm11(c1, c0, cv(hs0))
  df-3an(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0))
  jaod(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1))))
  elfzuz(cv(hs0), c1, co(c0, cmin, nat1))
  expcom(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  uztrn(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  elun(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cuz, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cun(co(c1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
}

blocks.name: uzdisj
blocks.content: The first ` N ` elements of an upper integer set are distinct from any later members. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzdisj(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1)), emptycls)
} = {
  ax-mp(wceq(cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1)), emptycls), wss(cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1)), emptycls))
  ssriv(hs0, cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1)), emptycls)
  pm2.21dd(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), emptycls), wbr(co(c1, cmin, nat1), clt, cv(hs0)))
  mpbid(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wbr(co(c1, cmin, nat1), clt, cv(hs0)), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  eluzle(cv(hs0), c1)
  syl2anc(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wb(wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(co(c1, cmin, nat1), clt, cv(hs0))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz))
  zlem1lt(c1, cv(hs0))
  lensymd(co(c1, cmin, nat1), cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))))
  zred(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  eluzelz(cv(hs0), c1)
  zred(co(c1, cmin, nat1), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(co(c1, cmin, nat1), cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  elinel2(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))
  eluzel2(cv(hs0), c1)
  peano2zm(c1)
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1))))
  elinel1(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1))
  elfzle2(cv(hs0), c0, co(c1, cmin, nat1))
  ss0(cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(cin(co(c0, cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(emptycls)
}

blocks.name: fseq1p1m1
blocks.content: Add/remove an item to/from the end of a finite sequence. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Nov-2012.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Mar-2014.)

  3jca(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), w3a(wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), c2), wcel(c3, c2), wceq(c4, cun(c1, c5)))), wf(c4, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, caddc, nat1)), c2), wceq(cfv(c4, co(c0, caddc, nat1)), c3), wceq(c1, cres(c4, co(nat1, cfz, c0))))

  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), w3a(wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), c2), wcel(c3, c2), wceq(c4, cun(c1, c5)))), wf(cun(c1, c5), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, caddc, nat1)), c2), wf(cun(c1, c5), cun(co(nat1, cfz, c0), csn(co(c0, caddc, nat1))), c2))

  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), w3a(wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), c2), wcel(c3, c2), wceq(c4, cun(c1, c5)))), wceq(co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, caddc, nat1)), cun(co(nat1, cfz, c0), csn(co(c0, caddc, nat1)))), wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, co(nat1, cmin, nat1))))
  syl6eleq(c0, cfv(cuz, co(nat1, cmin, nat1)), cn0, wa(wcel(c0, cn0), w3a(wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), c2), wcel(c3, c2), wceq(c4, cun(c1, c5)))))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cn0), w3a(wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), c2), wcel(c3, c2), wceq(c4, cun(c1, c5))))

  mpanl1(wcel(c1, cz), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cz), wcel(nat1, cz)), wb(wcel(co(c0, caddc, nat1), co(nat1, cfz, c1)), wcel(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cmin, nat1), co(co(nat1, cmin, nat1), cfz, co(c1, cmin, nat1)))), wcel(nat1, cz))

  nsyl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, nat1), co(c1, cfz, c0)), wbr(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cle, c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wn(wbr(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cle, c0)), wcel(c0, cr))
  eluzelre(c0, c1)
  mpbid(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wbr(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cle, c0)), wbr(c0, clt, co(c0, caddc, nat1)))
  ltp1(c0)

  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cz), wn(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c2))), wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c0)))
